content:
Just picking up this idea from another topic. Soz I should've done this in the first place.

Steve Howell (showell) said:

My personal pet peeve with Zulip is that we donâ€™t have a dialog box when you create a topic. Maybe we save the user from an extra mouse click or tap on the enter key. But we have a confusing experience where we literally sacrifice having a dialog with the user.

Interesting. I'm personally not too bothered about that so far, but I can see potential for improvement (especially for new and non-technical users) and you make a good point and I agree.

What if instead of the composer box permanently hanging down the bottom there is a button that opens a dialog box (similar to composing an email) that provides contextual options for better work flow? It could increase some slight screen real estate (maybe), potentially lessen confusion about creating a new topic (or replying to the current one), and the great work that's been done to the editor re markdown toolbars/tooltips could all go in...

Just thinking out loud... something like this... ?

What SoGo looks like:

Example-SoGo.gif

Brainstorm sketches...

Example-Zulip-ComposeButton.jpg

Example-Zulip-ComposeDialog.jpg

Or maybe something like this that has the same amount of clicks as exists now... then goes to dialog

Example2.png
A modal would make it harder to reference existing messages while composing a new message.
We are planning to offer a "full screen compose" toggle, not as a modal; I may be test-deploying that here later today.
